Event.0: A magnitude-7.8 earthquake struck near Kathmandu, Nepal, causing widespread damage and killing several thousand.
Event.1: In a cost-saving measure, the water supply of Flint, Michigan, was switched from the Detroit Water and Sewerage Department to the Flint River, causing a public health crisis as residents were exposed to dangerously high levels of lead.
Event.2: Comedian and actor Martin Lawrence (47) files for divorce from Shamicka Gibbs due to irreconcilable differences after 1.5 years of marriage
Event.3: "Angel" actress Amy Acker (26) weds actor James Carpinello (27) at Hans Fahden Vineyard in Napa Valley, California
Event.4: American dancer and actress Ginger Rogers, who starred with Fred Astaire in 10 popular Hollywood musicals, died in California.
Event.5: Designer Mary McFadden (52) announces divorce of Kohie Yohannan (23)
Event.6: Hubble space telescope is placed into orbit by shuttle Discovery
Event.7:
Hubble Space Telescope sent into orbit
The Hubble Space Telescope, a sophisticated optical observatory built in the United States under the supervision of NASA, was placed into operation this day in 1990 by the crew of the space shuttle Discovery.
Event.8: Maureen Reagan (40) marries 3rd husband, Dennis Revell (28)
Event.9:
Tim Duncan
American basketball player
was born
Event.10: Comedic actor Bob Denver (37) weds third wife Carole Abrahams
Event.11: 11th National Film Awards (India): "Shehar Aur Sapna" wins the Golden Lotus
Event.12: Bell labs announces the 1st solar battery made from silicon. It has about 6% efficiency.
Event.13: Francis Crick and James Watson's discovery of the double helix structure of DNA is published in "Nature" magazine
Event.14: Chuck Cooper becomes the 1st African American to be drafted into the NBA (for Boston Celtics)
Event.15: "Elbe Day" - US and Soviet forces meet at Torgau, Germany on the Elbe River during the invasion of Germany in WWII
Event.16:
Meadowlark Lemon
American basketball player
was born
Event.17: Giacomo Puccini's uncompleted opera Turandot was performed posthumously at La Scala under the direction of Arturo Toscanini.
Event.18: Giacomo Puccini's opera "Turandot" premieres in Milan
Event.19:
Ella Fitzgerald
American singer
was born
Event.20: The Australian and New Zealand Army Corps (ANZAC) landed at Gallipoli in western Turkey during the Dardanelles Campaign of World War I.
Event.21: Edward R. Murrow, a radio and television broadcaster who was the most influential and esteemed figure in American broadcast journalism during its formative years, was born in North Carolina.
Event.22: Guglielmo Marconi, an Italian physicist who invented a successful system of radio telegraphy (1896) and received the Nobel Prize for Physics (1909), was born.
Event.23: Construction of the Suez Canal officially began; completed 10 years later, the waterway connected the Mediterranean and Red seas.
Event.24: Thornton Affair: Open conflict begins over the disputed border of Texas, triggering the Mexican-American War
Event.25: The Treaty of Amritsar, which settled Indo-Sikh relations for a generation, was concluded between Charles T. Metcalfe, representing the British East India Company, and Ranjit Singh, head of the Sikh kingdom of Punjab.
Event.26: The first guillotine was erected, on the Place de Grève in Paris, to execute a highwayman.
Event.27: Guillotine first used in France, executes highwayman Nicolas Pelletier
Event.28: Petersburg, Virginia, was captured by British troops under William Phillips and Benedict Arnold during the American Revolution.
Event.29: English Convention Parliament meets and votes to restore Charles II
Event.30:
Oliver Cromwell
English statesman
was born
Event.31:
Edward II
king of England
was born
